intro: Thesium andongense, commonly known as the Andong thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Thesium andongense is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
